name: Sequoia Living San Francisco Senior Center
description: The San Francisco Senior Center (SFSC) opened in Aquatic Park in 1947 as the first nonprofit senior center in the United States. It began with a bold idea: to create a place where older adults (60+) and adults with disabilities (18+) could come together, learn, and build community. San Francisco Senior Center has two sites: (1). The Aquatic Park Center - located on the Bay across the street from Ghirardelli Square (2). The Downtown Center - location in the Tenderloin a block away from the Hilton
